docblock.description: The general error returned from Rosette API, indicating unrecognized format.
Internal error (api level) that indicates an incorrect datatype.
Internal error that throws if the Rosette API server version does not match the Api version.
Internal error indicating that the requested property does not exist.
Magic method to return the stringized form of CustomException.

tag.name: var
tag.description: ontent is the text to be analyzed (required if no contentUri)

tag.name: var
tag.description: contentUri is a URL to content that will be analyzed (required if no content)

tag.name: var
tag.description: contentType is the type of content RosetteConstants::$DataFormat (optional)

tag.name: var
tag.description: language is the language of the content (optional)

tag.name: return
tag.description: option value if set or null

docblock.description: Loads a file into the object.
docblock.long-description: The file will be read as bytes; the appropriate conversion will be determined by the server. The document unit size remains by default L{InputUnit.DOC}.

tag.name: param
tag.description: : Pathname of a file acceptable to the C{open} function.

docblock.long-description:
Api Python Client Binding API; representation of a Api server. Call instance methods upon this object to communicate with particular Api server endpoints. Aside from ping() and info(), most of the methods require the construction of either a DocumentParameters object or an NameTranslationParameters object. These provide the content data that will be processed by the service.
usage example: $api = new API($service_url, $user_key)

docblock.description: URL of the Rosette API (or test server).
True if the version has already been checked. Saves round trips.
Skips version check with server, not recommended.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An authentication string to be sent as user_key with all requests.

docblock.description: Creates the Request option based on current settings.
Processes the response, returning either the decoded Json or throwing an exception.
Internal operations processor for most of the endpoints.
Checks the server version against the api (or provided )version.
The response header that is returned by $http_response_header does not contain an explicit return code; it is in the first array element. This method extracts that code.
Creates the header string that is acceptable to file_get_contents.

tag.description: targetLanguage ISO 639-3 code for the translation language

tag.description: entityType type of entity, e.g. PERSON, LOCATION, ORGANIZATION (optional)

tag.name: var
tag.description: sourceLanguageOfOrigin ISO 693-3 code for name's language of origin (optional)

tag.name: var
tag.description: sourceLanguageOfUse ISO 693-3 code for name's language of use (optional)

docblock.description: Returns the message associated with the exception.
Returns the code associated with the exception.
Returns the file in which the exception occurred.
Returns the line at which the exception occurred.
Returns a trace of the exception.
Returns the trace in string format.
Override that returns the string representation of the exception.
Name represents an entity name in Rosette API.
